intro: Sapucaya schwackei, commonly known as the Andean bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the high Andes of South America. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky, high-altitude environments and is adapted to cold climates. Its leaves are usually narrow and grass-like, and it produces small, edible berries. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
